alert.note: Alert for Central Penobscot; Northern Washington; Southeast Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 12:40PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Washington, southeastern Aroostook and northeastern Penobscot Counties through 115 PM EDT... At 1239 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Wytopitlock, or 10 miles west of Danforth, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Danforth, Wytopitlock, Reed Plantation, Weston, Prentiss, Orient, Bancroft, Drew Plantation and Forest City. This includes US Highway 1 between Danforth and Orient. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Central Penobscot; Northern Washington; Southeast Aroostook
